intro: Scorzonera wendelboi, commonly known as the Wendelbo's scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces a taproot that is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. It thrives in rocky and well-drained soils at high altitudes. Scorzonera wendelboi is relatively rare and is considered a species of conservation concern in some regions.
